intro: Schoenocaulon tigrense, commonly known as the Sierra Valley bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue to violet flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as meadows and streambanks. It has hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves, and it blooms from June to August. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
